page.title: 10People
page.content: {Mrs Fuller Rowel}owns a teashop in Penshurst called the Fir Trees. She has a part time staff.She makes the cakes scones and bread herself. {Mr Hunter}has lived in Penshurst for 36 years. Ladies used to pick crops by hand. There were outdoor toilets which got very cold in the winter. {Mrs Cole}was housekeeper at Penshurst Place. The state rooms were not open to the public but those that were cost 6d (2 1/2p) to see: 2d for funds, 2d for the Lord and 2d to the person collecting. {Mr Hubbard}is game keeper at Penshurst Place. He keeps dogs and ferrets and his hobby is collecting shotguns, he has 10 of them. He gets up at 6.00 to go to work. He has been a game keeper all his life and his father and grandfather before him.
